text: it's mark Wiens I am in krabi town in
the south of Thailand and I'm sitting
down at a la caja which is kind of an
evening Street food open-air hawker
centre market which is right along the
water's edge and it's open-air there are
a bunch of different food choices it has
become a little bit touristy but at the
same time there are lots of different
choices for what to order and this is a
good place to try a bunch of different
Thai Street food dishes this market
opens in the evening starting at about
4:00 about 4 or 5 p.m. or so if you kind
of wander over here in the evening
you'll find a bunch of different stalls
and you can find all sorts of different
street food dishes especially lots of
stir-fried dishes I chose to sit at one
of the stir fry restaurants where you
can basically choose any kind of
combination of stir-fried dishes that
you like and they have a menu both in
Thai and English so it's pretty easy to
order got a couple of different dishes
this dish is called Suffolk Haan kabhi
and it is stink beans
stir-fried well I got it with pork and
then stir-fried with shrimp paste
so stink beans are of course you'll
probably be seeing a lot of stink beans
when I'm making videos in the south
because I like to eat it almost every
meal as long as I have a chance
that's awesome
you can just never go wrong with stink
beads they are the world's gem of an
ingredient but that's that's a style of
cooking stink beans with shrimp paste
and then it has so it has sort of a
salty shrimpy flavor to it
but really it doesn't you might not even
know it's that shrimpy if you just taste
it without knowing it's shrimp paste but
it just has that really sharp that
really sharp saltiness and it is a
little bit sour and a little bit sweet
and then paired with that pork and then
I can taste a lot of garlic in there and
some chilies as well some pick numbat
chilies
I got a plate of POD kana which is uh
like Chinese broccoli just stir-fried up
with oyster sauce I'll put that onto my
rice and making sure to get those
chilies on the bottom of my spoon as
well
just always good fresh vegetables it's
crisp
it's salty and yeah I love all kinds of
vegetables okay finally this is poppin
cha which is fish which I think they've
deep-fried yeah they've deep-fried it
and then fried it with with crotch i
which is finger root and then basil
looks like there's some holy basil and
chiles and yeah pod cha is a wonderful
style of stir frying and Thai cuisine
put that onto the rice it's more of
those chilies up on there
it's a little on the salty side but but
good the fish is a little bit crispy and
I can really taste the finger root kind
of a gingery flavor an earthy ginger
flavor that was a good quick and simple
dinner here in Kentucky
definitely the top hot guppy was
definitely the best dish but everything
was okay a little on the salty side but
okay but this is a nice place to come if
you are looking for a simple dinner you
can just choose a variety of different
dishes there are a number of different
stir-fried restaurants but there are
also noodle stalls there are lots of
like smoothies stalls fruit smoothie
stalls there's like a place where you
can get grilled seafood so if you come
to cut meat and if you are looking for
this type of dining this is a place you
can check out in the evening
